title: Building Innovation Infrastructure from Zero
subtitle: How I created Gerresheimer's first systematic approach to innovation in a 150-year-old medical packaging company

sections.heading: The Challenge
sections.content:
Gerresheimer had no formal innovation function. In a 150-year-old company operating in heavily regulated medical packaging, "innovation" meant incremental product improvements driven by customer requests—not systematic exploration of new opportunities. 

The real constraints weren't technical. They were cultural and structural:

* Every change requires compliance validation (FDA, EMA regulations)
* Engineers optimized for risk avoidance, not experimentation
* No budget or mandate for exploratory work
* Innovation was everyone's side project and no one's priority

quote.text: "Innovation in a regulated industry isn't about moving fast and breaking things. It's about creating safe spaces for experimentation within a system designed to prevent change."
